column4: what else besides some basic ide modules would be needed for ubuntu to detect my cdroms
hopefully nothing, the installer should have everything it needs in the initrd ...
it didn't..I used net install and have an sata hard disk if that would effect it
hm, I have some discover1 patches queued for i915, may be similar
do you have a full Linux installation elsewhere on that box?
ok, please switch to tty2 and type 'cut -f1,2 /proc/bus/pci/devices'
you'll have to transcribe it I'm afraid, but it's not too long
if you have a full Ubuntu install on the same machine, mail me the output of 'lspci' and 'lspci -n'
hm, possible, I've stuck that in the bug
our toolchain isn't that significantly differemt from Debian's
was talking about difference between ubuntu and gentoo
ah, the discussion above was mixed-up, couldn't quite tell
actually I think the PuTTY terminal's much better than gnome-terminal
of course, as the Debian putty maintainer I'm a little biased
